intro: Gynoxys pendula var. sinuata, commonly known as the Sinuous Hanging Sycamore, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pendulous, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a distinctive sinuous margin, giving it its varietal name. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
